data.enText: a lack of interest, feeling or reaction towards sb/sth
data.chText: 漠不关心；冷淡；不感兴趣；无动于衷

data.enText: his total indifference to what people thought of him
data.chText: 他对别人怎么看他毫不在乎的态度

data.enText: What she said is a matter of complete indifference to me.
data.chText: 她的话对于我来说完全无关紧要。

data.enText: Their father treated them with indifference.
data.chText: 他们的父亲对他们漠不关心。

data.enText: an indifference to the needs of others
data.chText: 对于他人的需要置若罔闻

tr: the trait of lacking enthusiasm for or interest in things generally
the trait of remaining calm and seeming not to care
apathy demonstrated by an absence of emotional reactions

example.ex: ...his callous indifference to the plight of his son.
example.tran: 他对儿子所处困境的无情漠视

example.ex: ...the prejudice and indifference which surround the Aids epidemic.
example.tran: 对艾滋病传播的偏见与漠视

value.def: If you accuse someone of indifference to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it.
